comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: John Grier Hibben, President of Princeton University. He succeeded Woodrow Wilson in this role.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Hibben was photographed during the June 13, 1914, visit to the Princeton campus of U. S. President Thomas Woodrow Wilson, a member of the Princeton graduating class of 1879, who participated in the 35th anniversary reunion of his class, part of the commencement week festivities at Princeton. "President is just 'Tommy" for a day" --New York Times story, June 14, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=F7091FF73C5E13...
